alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Coos; Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 04 at 3:52PM EDT until July 04 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Carroll County in northern New Hampshire... South Central Coos County in northern New Hampshire... Central Grafton County in northern New Hampshire... * Until 630 PM EDT. * At 352 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. The expected rainfall rate is 2 to 3 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. Heavy rain associated with thunderstorms will cause small streams and brooks to rise. This could prove hazardous to hikers or recreational visitors to the area. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Conway, Bethlehem, Lincoln, Haverhill, Canaan, Franconia, Groton, Woodstock, Sandwich and Mount Washington. This includes the following Rec locations... Crawford Notch State Park, Franconia Notch, and the White Mountain National Forest. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
